tabs.sql: SELECT * FROM NetworkActivityIOS;
tabs.title: Network Activity
tabs.text: Explore every connection made by your applications to a particular domain. The result is limited to the last two weeks since you activated the App Privacy Report.

tabs.sql: SELECT * FROM ResourceAccessIOS GROUP BY identifier;
tabs.title: Resource Access
tabs.text: Explore every access your apps have made to a resource on your device. The result is limited to the last two weeks since you activated the App Privacy Report.

tabs.sql: SELECT name AS advertiserName, o.timestamp AS date_, COUNT(*) AS count_ FROM OffFacebookActivityEvent o GROUP BY name, o.timestamp;
tabs.title: Off Facebook activity ranking
tabs.text: See how many times third parties have informed Facebook of your activity outside of Facebook.

tabs.sql: SELECT name AS targetingType, type AS targetingValue, COUNT(*) AS count_ FROM OffFacebookActivityEvent WHERE targetingType IN ( SELECT name FROM OffFacebookActivityEvent GROUP BY name ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 10 ) GROUP BY targetingType, targetingValue
tabs.title: Off Facebook activity type
tabs.text: See which kind of information advertisers have shared with Facebook of your activity outside of Facebook.

tabs.sql: SELECT title, a.action, a.timestamp FROM AdvertiserInteraction a GROUP BY title, a.timestamp;
tabs.title: Ad interactions
tabs.text: See the list of ads with which you have interacted.

tabs.sql: SELECT name FROM AdsInterest
tabs.title: Inferred interests
tabs.text: Get a list of topics that Facebook thinks you're interested in.

tabs.sql: SELECT * FROM AdvertiserUploadedContactInformation;
tabs.title: Contact list
tabs.text: Get a list of advertisers that have uploaded a contact list containing you.

tabs.sql: SELECT * FROM CustomAudience;
tabs.title: Advertisers using your data
tabs.text: See all advertisers that use Facebook to get information about you

tabs.title: Timeline
tabs.text: See all the dated events in your files, corresponding to data that has been collected on you at or concerning a specific date.

tabs.title: Location observations
tabs.text: See all the location events in your files, corresponding to data that has been collected on you at or concerning a specific location.

tabs.sql: SELECT * FROM PlaceVisit;
tabs.title: Places visited
tabs.text: This map shows what places Google think you visited with the size corresponding to the time you spent in this place:

tabs.sql: SELECT winnerLatitude, winnerLongitude, winnerAddress, winnerName, winnerConfidence, winnerSemanticType, loserLatitude, loserLongitude, loserAddress, loserName, loserConfidence, loserSemanticType, startTimestamp, endTimestamp FROM Winners INNER JOIN Losers ON Winners.id = Losers.loserId
tabs.title: One Place

tabs.sql: SELECT winnerLatitude, winnerLongitude, winnerAddress, winnerName, winnerConfidence, winnerSemanticType, loserLatitude, loserLongitude, loserAddress, loserName, loserConfidence, loserSemanticType, startTimestamp, endTimestamp FROM Winners INNER JOIN Losers ON Winners.id = Losers.loserId
tabs.title: Other Candidates
tabs.text: This map shows the other candidate places proposed by Google linked to the location that Google think you visited:

tabs.sql: SELECT * FROM ActivitySegment;
tabs.title: Travels
tabs.text: This map shows what trips Google think you did:

tabs.sql: WITH a AS ( SELECT * FROM Records ORDER BY Records.timestamp DESC LIMIT 100000 ) SELECT a.latitude, a.longitude, a.timestamp, a.accuracy, a.source, ActivitySegment.activityType FROM a, ActivitySegment WHERE a.timestamp >= startTimestamp AND a.timestamp <= endTimestamp
tabs.title: Records
tabs.text: This map shows records associated to a trip with the color corresponding to an activity type:

tabs.sql: SELECT mac, AVG(latitude) AS latitude, AVG(longitude) AS longitude, COUNT(*) AS number_of_detections FROM WifiScan INNER JOIN MacAdresses ON WifiScan.id = MacAdresses.macId GROUP BY mac ORDER BY COUNT() DESC
tabs.title: Wifi
tabs.text: This map shows where your phone detected mac addresses with the size corresponding to the number of times it was detected:

tabs.sql: SELECT * FROM HerProfile;
tabs.title: User Infos
tabs.text: HER profile information

tabs.sql: WITH TempLike AS ( SELECT SUBSTR(likedAt, 1, 10) AS likedAt FROM HerLike ), TempSkip AS ( SELECT SUBSTR(skippedAt, 1, 10) AS skippedAt FROM HerSkip ) SELECT likedAt AS date_, "Like" AS actionValue, COUNT(*) AS actionCount FROM TempLike GROUP BY likedAt UNION SELECT skippedAt AS date_, "Skip" AS actionValue, COUNT(*) AS actionCount FROM TempSkip GROUP BY skippedAt;
tabs.title: Likes and Passes
tabs.text: Number of likes and passes that you made over time.

tabs.sql: SELECT * FROM HerNotification;
tabs.title: Notifications
tabs.text: Number of notifications that you recieved over time.

tabs.sql: SELECT * FROM HerLike;
tabs.title: Matches
tabs.text: Look at the likes you've made that have become matches or not.

tabs.sql: SELECT * FROM HerMessage;
tabs.title: Messages
tabs.text: Message Activity

tabs.sql: SELECT * FROM HerBlock;
tabs.title: Blocks
tabs.text: Blocks that you established over time.

tabs.sql: SELECT * FROM HerReport;
tabs.title: Reported
tabs.text: Users that you reported to the moderation.

tabs.sql: SELECT accountName, DATETIME(unixTimestamp, 'unixepoch') AS actionDate, 'Post Viewed' AS actionType FROM InstagramPostViewed UNION SELECT accountName, DATETIME(unixTimestamp, 'unixepoch') AS actionDate, 'Video Watched' AS actionType FROM InstagramVideoWatched UNION SELECT accountName, DATETIME(unixTimestamp, 'unixepoch') AS actionDate, 'Ad Viewed' AS actionType FROM InstagramAdViewed;
tabs.title: Views

tabs.sql: SELECT accountName, DATETIME(unixTimestamp, 'unixepoch') AS actionDate, 'Comment Liked' AS actionType FROM InstagramCommentLiked UNION SELECT accountName, DATETIME(unixTimestamp, 'unixepoch') AS actionDate, 'Post Liked' AS actionType FROM InstagramPostLiked;
tabs.title: Likes

tabs.sql: SELECT senderName, messageContent, DATETIME(ROUND(timestampMS / 1000), 'unixepoch') AS sendDatetime FROM InstagramMessage;
tabs.title: Messages

tabs.sql: SELECT accountName, accountURL, DATETIME(ROUND(timestampMS), 'unixepoch') AS followDate, 'Follower' AS followType FROM InstagramFollower UNION SELECT accountName, accountURL, DATETIME(ROUND(timestampMS), 'unixepoch') AS followDate, 'Following' AS followType FROM InstagramFollowing;
tabs.title: Follows
Timeline
tabs.text: See all the dated events in your files, corresponding to data that has been collected on you at or concerning a specific date.

tabs.title: Inferences about you
tabs.text: Each card below represents an inference that Linkedin has made about you, either positively or negatively, e.g. Am I a joob seeker -> true or false.

tabs.title: Ad targeting
tabs.text: This information is used by Linkedin to determine which ads to show you. Some of the targeting data may be derived from other information you have provided to them. For example, they may use your title as an indication of your seniority level.

tabs.title: Connections
tabs.text: This tool allows you to track all the connections you have made with Linkedin, you can filter by date, day or by company and position in your address book.

tabs.title: Timeline
tabs.text: See all the dated events in your files, corresponding to data that has been collected on you at or concerning a specific date.

tabs.title: Viewing activity
tabs.text: Get an overview of how you use Netflix and what information is stored about you

tabs.title: Notifications
tabs.text: See how many times Netflix sent you notifications

tabs.title: Timeline
tabs.text: See all the dated events in your files, corresponding to data that has been collected on you at or concerning a specific date.

tabs.sql: SELECT * FROM LoginHistory;
tabs.title: Login History
tabs.text: When and where you logged in

tabs.sql: SELECT date_, actionType, COUNT(*) AS count_ FROM ( SELECT SUBSTR(DATE, 0, INSTR(DATE, ' ')) AS date_, 'Follower' AS actionType FROM TiktokFollowerList UNION SELECT SUBSTR(DATE, 0, INSTR(DATE, ' ')) AS date_, 'Following' AS actionType FROM TiktokFollowingList ) GROUP BY date_, actionType;
tabs.title: Following vs Follower
tabs.text: See how much you have follow or have been followed during time

tabs.sql: SELECT * FROM ( SELECT DATE AS date_, searchterm AS activityValue, 'Search' AS activityType FROM SearchHistory UNION SELECT DATE AS date_, link AS activityValue, 'Share' AS activityType FROM ShareHistory UNION SELECT DATE AS date_, videolink AS activityValue, 'Like' AS activityType FROM LikeList UNION SELECT DATE AS date_, videolink AS activityValue, 'Watch' AS activityType FROM VideoBrowsingHistory UNION SELECT DATE AS date_, username AS activityValue, 'Block' AS activityType FROM BlockList UNION SELECT DATE AS date_, comment AS activityValue, 'Comment' AS activityType FROM TiktokComment )
tabs.title: Activity History
tabs.text: Consult every actions you have made on the app.

tabs.sql: SELECT * FROM ChatHistory;
tabs.title: Chat Activity
tabs.text: Private messages sent and received

tabs.sql: SELECT * FROM TinderUser;
tabs.title: User infos
tabs.text: Tinder profile information

tabs.sql: SELECT dateValue, actionType, amount FROM TinderUsage WHERE actionType = 'app_opens';
tabs.text: See the number of times that you opened the app per day.
tabs.title: Usage

tabs.sql: SELECT dateValue, actionType, amount FROM TinderUsage WHERE actionType = 'swipes_likes' OR actionType = 'swipes_passes'
tabs.text: See the number of likes and passes that you made over time.
tabs.title: Likes and passes

tabs.sql: SELECT * FROM TinderMessage;
tabs.title: Messages
tabs.text: See at what time of the day and week you send the most messages

tabs.sql: SELECT dateValue, MAX( CASE WHEN actionType = 'swipes_likes' THEN amount ELSE 0 END ) likes, MAX( CASE WHEN actionType = 'superlikes' THEN amount ELSE 0 END ) number_of_superlikes, MAX( CASE WHEN actionType = 'swipes_passes' THEN amount ELSE 0 END ) passes, MAX( CASE WHEN actionType = 'messages_sent' THEN amount ELSE 0 END ) number_of_messages_sent, MAX( CASE WHEN actionType = 'messages_received' THEN amount ELSE 0 END ) number_of_messages_received, MAX( CASE WHEN actionType = 'matches' THEN amount ELSE 0 END ) number_of_matches, MAX( CASE WHEN actionType = 'app_opens' THEN amount ELSE 0 END ) opens FROM TinderUsage GROUP BY dateValue;
tabs.text: Compare the different actions you perform in the application.
tabs.title: Comparison

tabs.sql: SELECT dateValue, MAX( CASE WHEN actionType = 'swipes_likes' THEN amount ELSE NULL END ) likes, MAX( CASE WHEN actionType = 'swipes_passes' THEN amount ELSE NULL END ) passes, MAX( CASE WHEN actionType = 'app_opens' THEN amount ELSE NULL END ) opens FROM TinderUsage GROUP BY dateValue;
tabs.text: Observe the possible correlation between the number of likes/passes and the number of times you open the app.
tabs.title: Likes / passes correlation

axes.title: Number of times the application is opened per day
Nombre de fois que l'application est ouverte par jour

tabs.title: Overview
tabs.text: Monitor below all the tracking done on your smartphone applications. You can filter the results by selecting a time range, selecting certain apps in the dropdown, clicking on each graph, or using the table filters or search box.

tabs.sql: WITH EngagementCount AS ( SELECT a.tweetId, a.advertiserName, a.displayLocation, a.time, COUNT(*) AS count_ FROM TwitterAd a, TwitterEngagement e WHERE a.tweetId = e.tweetId AND a.advertiserName = e.advertiserName AND a.displayLocation = e.displayLocation -- We only consider engagements that occur -- within 120 sec of a corresponding impression. -- 60 sec x 60 min x 24 hours = 86,400 sec AND ABS( ROUND((JULIANDAY(a.time) - JULIANDAY(e.time)) * 86400) ) < 120 GROUP BY a.tweetId, a.advertiserName, a.displayLocation, a.time ), Engagement AS ( SELECT a.tweetId, a.advertiserName AS companyName, -- Return 0 if ad has no engagements IFNULL( ( SELECT ec.count_ FROM EngagementCount ec WHERE a.tweetId = ec.tweetId AND a.advertiserName = ec.advertiserName AND a.displayLocation = ec.displayLocation AND a.time = ec.time ), 0 ) engagements, a.time AS date_, c.targetingType, c.targetingValue FROM TwitterAd a INNER JOIN TwitterCriterion c ON a.id = c.adId ) SELECT ( -- Yes/No is interpreted as BOOLEAN by type-check.js CASE WHEN e.engagements IS 0 THEN 'No' ELSE 'Yes' END ) AS engagedWith, e.* FROM Engagement e
tabs.title: Advertising overview
tabs.text: Understand how much, who and why you are being targeted by Twitter ads in this interactive visualization. Click on any graph to filter the results.

tabs.sql: WITH EngagementCount AS ( SELECT a.tweetId, a.advertiserName, a.displayLocation, a.time, COUNT(*) AS count_ FROM TwitterAd a, TwitterEngagement e WHERE a.tweetId = e.tweetId AND a.advertiserName = e.advertiserName AND a.displayLocation = e.displayLocation -- We only consider engagements that occur -- within 120 sec of a corresponding impression. -- 60 sec x 60 min x 24 hours = 86,400 sec AND ABS( ROUND((JULIANDAY(a.time) - JULIANDAY(e.time)) * 86400) ) < 120 GROUP BY a.tweetId, a.advertiserName, a.displayLocation, a.time ), Engagement AS ( SELECT a.tweetId, a.advertiserName AS companyName, -- Return 0 if ad has no engagements IFNULL( ( SELECT ec.count_ FROM EngagementCount ec WHERE a.tweetId = ec.tweetId AND a.advertiserName = ec.advertiserName AND a.displayLocation = ec.displayLocation AND a.time = ec.time ), 0 ) engagements, a.time AS date_, c.targetingType, c.targetingValue FROM TwitterAd a INNER JOIN TwitterCriterion c ON a.id = c.adId WHERE a.time > DATE('now', '-1 month') ) SELECT ( -- Yes/No is interpreted as BOOLEAN by type-check.js CASE WHEN e.engagements IS 0 THEN 'No' ELSE 'Yes' END ) AS engagedWith, e.* FROM Engagement e
tabs.title: Advertising overview (last month)
tabs.text: Understand how much, who and why you have been targeted by Twitter ads last month in this interactive visualization. Click on any graph to filter the results.

tabs.sql: SELECT advertiserName, DATE(t.time) AS date_, COUNT(*) AS count_ FROM TwitterAd t GROUP BY advertiserName;
tabs.title: Top advertisers
tabs.text: See the ranking of advertisers that have shown you the most ads.

tabs.sql: SELECT advertiserName, targetingType, targetingValue, COUNT(*) AS count_ FROM TwitterAd INNER JOIN TwitterCriterion ON TwitterAd.id = TwitterCriterion.adId WHERE TwitterAd.advertiserName IN ( SELECT advertiserName FROM TwitterAd GROUP BY advertiserName ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 10 ) GROUP BY advertiserName, targetingType, targetingValue
tabs.title: Targeting criteria (Top 10 advertisers)
tabs.text: Understand why you have been targeted by these advertisers. The graph shows the 10 advertisers who use the most targeting criteria on you. In the first ring you will find the different advertisers, in the second ring the types of targeting used (location, language, ...). And finally, if you click on a ring, the graph will enlarge to show you the targeting values (Swiss, French, ...) in the outer ring.

tabs.sql: SELECT targetingType, targetingValue, COUNT(*) AS count_ FROM TwitterCriterion GROUP BY targetingType, targetingValue;

value.Follower look-alikes: Twitter determine users similar to those who follow accounts based on a variety of signals, including what they Retweet, click on, Tweet, and more.
value.Interests: Twitter determine interests based on a variety of signals, including who they follow, what they Retweet, click on, Tweet, and more.
value.App Activity: Reach groups of people who have taken a specific action in your app, such as installs or sign-ups.
value.Website Activity: It is possible to collect this data using Twitter's website tag available through Twitter Ads.
value.List: Lists are created by uploading a file containing your email address, mobile advertising ID or Twitter username.
value.Conversation topics: People may be considered part of a conversation audience if they've Tweeted or engaged with a Tweet mentioning the topic.
value.Keywords: Keyword targeting allows advertisers to reach people on Twitter based on keywords in their search queries, recent Tweets, and Tweets they recently engaged with.
value.Locations: Twitters geo targeting is based on someone's recent location. This is a combination of current location and recent location history. Twitter uses several signals for determining whether someone is presently in a particular geographic location, such as web IP address, mobile GPS signal, mobile WiFi signal, and real-time signals, such as when someone includes their location in a Tweet.
value.Age: If not specified in your Twitter profile, Twitter deduct it from users who did it, based on a number of attributes such as the accounts they follows and their interests.
value.Languages: Twitter derive a persons language from the language selected in their profile settings, the languages that correspond to their activity on Twitter and more.
value.Gender: Twitter use the gender provided by people in their profiles, and extend that data to other people based on factors of account likeness to determine the gender of people haven't manually entered their preferred gender.
value.OS versions: Advertisers can target by Operating System (e.g IOS vs Android)
value.Platforms: Advertisers can target by platform used by the client (e.g Iphone 7 vs Iphone 8)
value.Events: With event targeting, Twitter can discover and target the events that best fit the advertisers' audience  then create a campaign that delivers their ads at just the right time to just the right audience as the event unfolds.

tooltip.signal: datum.targetingValue + " was used by " + datum.count_ + " advertiser(s)"

value.Follower look-alikes: Twitter dtermine les utilisateurs similaires  ceux qui suivent des comptes sur la base d'une varit de signaux, notamment ce qu'ils retweetent, cliquent, tweetent, etc.
value.Interests: Twitter dtermine les intrts en fonction de divers signaux, notamment les personnes qu'elles suivent, ce qu'elles retweetent, ce qu'elles cliquent, ce qu'elles tweetent, etc
value.App Activity: Atteignez les groupes de personnes qui ont effectu une action spcifique dans votre application, comme des installations ou des inscriptions.
value.Website Activity: Il est possible de collecter ces donnes  l'aide de la balise de site web de Twitter disponible via Twitter Ads.
value.List: Les listes sont cres en tlchargeant un fichier contenant votre adresse e-mail, votre identifiant publicitaire mobile ou votre nom d'utilisateur Twitter.
value.Conversation topics: Les personnes peuvent tre considres comme faisant partie d'une audience de conversation si elles ont tweet ou se sont engages avec un tweet mentionnant le sujet.
value.Keywords: Le ciblage par mot-cl permet aux annonceurs d'atteindre des personnes sur Twitter sur la base de mots-cls dans leurs requtes de recherche, de Tweets rcents et de Tweets avec lesquels ils se sont rcemment engags.
value.Locations: Le ciblage gographique de Twitter est bas sur la localisation rcente d'une personne. Il s'agit d'une combinaison de la localisation actuelle et de l'historique des localisations rcentes. Twitter utilise plusieurs signaux pour dterminer si quelqu'un se trouve actuellement dans un lieu gographique particulier, comme l'adresse IP web, le signal GPS mobile, le signal WiFi mobile, et des signaux en temps rel, comme lorsque quelqu'un inclut son emplacement dans un Tweet.
value.Age: S'il n'est pas spcifi dans votre profil Twitter, Twitter le dduit des utilisateurs qui l'ont fait, en se basant sur un certain nombre d'attributs tels que les comptes qu'ils suivent et leurs intrts
value.Languages: Twitter dduit la langue d'une personne  partir de la langue slectionne dans les paramtres de son profil, des langues qui correspondent  son activit sur Twitter et plus encore.
value.Gender: Twitter utilise le genre fourni par les personnes dans leurs profils, et tend ces donnes  d'autres personnes en fonction de facteurs de ressemblance de comptes pour dterminer le genre des personnes n'ayant pas saisi manuellement leur genre prfr.
value.OS versions: Les annonceurs peuvent cibler par systme d'exploitation (par exemple, IOS vs Android)
value.Platforms: Les annonceurs peuvent cibler par plateforme utilise par le client (par exemple Iphone 7 vs Iphone 8)
value.Events: Avec le ciblage par vnement, Twitter peut dcouvrir et cibler les vnements qui correspondent le mieux  l'audience des annonceurs - puis crer une campagne qui diffuse leurs publicits au bon moment,  la bonne audience, au fur et  mesure que l'vnement se droule.

tooltip.signal: datum.targetingValue + " a t utilis " + datum.count_ + " annonceur(s)"

tabs.title: Targeting criteria (All advertisers)
tabs.text: Get more details on how you are targeted by these advertisers. This graph shows the number of times you have been targeted by different advertisers using a specific criterion. You can change the type of criterion and get information about the meaning of each criterion's type at the bottom of the graph.

tabs.sql: SELECT advertiserName, targetingType, targetingValue, COUNT(*) AS count_ FROM TwitterAd INNER JOIN TwitterCriterion ON TwitterAd.id = TwitterCriterion.adId GROUP BY advertiserName, targetingType, targetingValue;
tabs.title: Targeting criteria (1 advertiser)
tabs.text: Visualize the targeting criteria used by one specific advertiser. You can look up the advertiser in the table below and click on it to visualise them.
